name: Absolution
components: V, S, M (a vial of holy water), DF
description:
You purge impure thoughts from the target’s mind and fill him with exultant relief at the forgiveness of his sins. _Absolution_ ends all [charm](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/magic#TOC-Enchantment-Charm) or [compulsion](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/magic#TOC-Enchantment-Compulsion) effects affecting the target (including harmless compulsions, such as [heroism](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/magic/all-spells/a/h/heroism)) as per [break enchantment](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/magic/all-spells/a/b/break-enchantment). If the target was forced to perform any actions contrary to his [alignment](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/basics-ability-scores/glossary#TOC-Alignment), [monk](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/classes/core-classes/monk) vows, [paladin](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/classes/core-classes/paladin) oath, or similar code of conduct by that [charm](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/magic#TOC-Enchantment-Charm) or [compulsion](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/magic#TOC-Enchantment-Compulsion) effect, that action doesn’t cause him to lose access to class abilities, including divine spellcasting.

Unlike an [atonement](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/magic/all-spells/a/atonement) spell, _absolution_ can’t reverse [alignment](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/basics-ability-scores/glossary#TOC-Alignment) change or the effects of willing transgressions, induce a creature to change its [alignment](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/basics-ability-scores/glossary#TOC-Alignment), or restore class abilities lost because of misdeeds performed in the past. _Absolution_ automatically works if the caster and the target share the same [alignment](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/basics-ability-scores/glossary#TOC-Alignment) or the same patron deity. If they don’t, but their alignments are within one step of each other, _absolution_ has a 5% chance of success per [caster level](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/magic#TOC-Caster-Level). If neither of these is true, the spell automatically fails.

If using [the honor subsystem](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/gamemastering/other-rules/honor), casting _absolution_ also eliminates the honor loss for events and actions committed by the target while he was affected by a [charm](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/magic#TOC-Enchantment-Charm) or [compulsion](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/magic#TOC-Enchantment-Compulsion) effect that the spell ended.

name: Adhesive Spittle
description: Once during this spell’s duration, you can spit a viscous liquid as a [standard action](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/gamemastering/combat#TOC-Standard-Actions). This liquid functions as a [tanglefoot bag](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/equipment/goods-and-services/herbs-oils-other-substances#TOC-Tanglefoot-Bag), except you do not have to make a successful [attack roll](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/gamemastering/combat#TOC-Attack-Roll) to hit your target. The DCs to counteract this adhesive (to avoid being stuck to the floor, to fly, to break the adhesive, or to cast a spell) use the spell’s DC rather than a [tanglefoot bag’s](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/equipment/goods-and-services/herbs-oils-other-substances#TOC-Tanglefoot-Bag) normal DCs. The adhesive persists for 2d4 rounds after you spit it.

name: Age Resistance
description: You ignore the physical detriments of being middle-aged. This spell does not cause you to look younger, nor does it prevent you from [dying](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/gamemastering/conditions#TOC-Dying) of old age, but as long as the spell is in effect, you ignore the –1 penalties to [Strength](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/basics-ability-scores/ability-scores#TOC-Strength-Str-), [Dexterity](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/basics-ability-scores/ability-scores#TOC-Dexterity-Dex-), and [Constitution](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/basics-ability-scores/ability-scores#TOC-Constitution-Con-) that accrue once you become middle-aged. You retain the age-related bonuses to [Intelligence](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/basics-ability-scores/ability-scores#TOC-Intelligence-Int-), [Wisdom](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/basics-ability-scores/ability-scores#TOC-Wisdom-Wis-), and [Charisma](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/basics-ability-scores/ability-scores#TOC-Charisma-Cha-) while under the effects of this spell. Additional penalties that you accrue upon becoming old or venerable apply in full.

name: Animal Purpose Training
levels: antipaladin 1, bard 2, druid 2, inquisitor 1, paladin 1, psychic 1, ranger 1, shaman 2, witch 1
components: V, S, M (a swatch of black cloth)
description: You instill the target [animal](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/bestiary/rules-for-monsters/creature-types#TOC-Animal) with a general purpose (see the [Handle Animal](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/skills/handle-animal) skill), which can be any purpose except combat training—fighting, guarding, heavy labor, hunting, performance, or riding. This purpose supersedes the [animal’s](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/bestiary/rules-for-monsters/creature-types#TOC-Animal) previous trained purpose and any tricks it knows. When the spell ends, the [animal](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/bestiary/rules-for-monsters/creature-types#TOC-Animal) reverts to its previous trained purpose and known tricks.

name: Anti-Incorporeal Shell
description:
You bring into being a mobile, hemispherical energy field that [incorporeal](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/bestiary/rules-for-monsters/universal-monster-rules/#TOC-Incorporeal-Ex-) creatures cannot enter.

This spell can be used only defensively, not aggressively. Forcing an [abjuration](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/magic#TOC-Abjuration) barrier against creatures that the spell keeps at bay collapses the barrier.

name: Aphasia
description:
You render the target unable to understand any language, including spoken language, written language, sign language, gestures attempting to mimic a crude language, or even truespeech and [telepathy](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/bestiary/rules-for-monsters/universal-monster-rules#TOC-Telepathy-Su-). The affected creature is unable to communicate, use command words, cast spells with verbal [components](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/magic#TOC-Components), or use any other abilities that requires language.

At the end of each of its turns, the subject can attempt a new saving throw to end the effect.

[Tongues](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/magic/all-spells/t/tongues/) counters and dispels aphasia, and a creature with the [tongues](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/magic/all-spells/t/tongues/) spell active is immune to aphasia. Oracles with the [tongues](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/magic/all-spells/t/tongues/) curse ignore aphasia in combat.

name: Blade Tutor’s Spirit
description:
You summon an insubstantial spirit of force that resembles a cloudy vapor hovering around your fists or any melee weapons you wield. The spirit compensates for your defensive or reckless melee attacks, nudging your weapons in the proper direction.

When you voluntarily use one or more actions or feats that apply penalties to [attack rolls](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/gamemastering/combat#TOC-Attack-Roll) with your melee weapons (such as a charge, fighting defensively, or using the [Power Attack](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/feats/combat-feats/power-attack-combat) feat), the spirit reduces the total penalty on affected attacks by 1 (to a minimum penalty of 0). The penalty is reduced by an additional 1 for every 5 caster levels you possess (to a minimum penalty of 0). Only penalties incurred by voluntary use of feats or maneuvers are reduced by this spell.

The spirit can’t be attacked or harmed by physical attacks, but [disintegrate](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/magic/all-spells/d/disintegrate), [dispel magic](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/magic/all-spells/d/dispel-magic), a [_rod of cancellation_](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/magic-items/rods/rod-of-cancellation), or a [_sphere of annihilation_](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/magic-items/artifacts/minor-artifacts/sphere-of-annihilation) can affect it. A protective spirit’s AC against [touch](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/gamemastering/combat#TOC-Touch-Attacks) attacks is equal to 10 + your [Dexterity](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/basics-ability-scores/ability-scores#TOC-Dexterity-Dex-) modifier.

name: Blessing of Liberty
components: V, S, M (a feather or small object that symbolizes good fortune)
description: You imbue yourself with the blessings of liberty. You gain a +1 [luck bonus](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/basics-ability-scores/glossary#TOC-Luck-Bonus) per 6 caster levels (minimum +1, maximum +3) to your [CMD](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/gamemastering/combat#TOC-Combat-Maneuver-Defense) and on saving throws against spells and traps that would move you or impede your movement. You can end the spell’s effects as a [swift action](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/gamemastering/combat#TOC-Swift-Actions) to gain a +20 foot [enhancement bonus](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/basics-ability-scores/glossary#TOC-Enhancement-Bonus) to your base [speed](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/magic-items/magic-weapons/magic-weapon-special-abilities/speed) for 1 round per whole minute of duration remaining.

name: Bloatbomb
savingThrow: Fort negates or Reflex half (see text)
description: The target creature dies if it fails a [Fortitude](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/gamemastering/combat#TOC-Fortitude) saving throw and its [Hit Dice](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/basics-ability-scores/glossary#TOC-Hit-Dice-HD-) are no more than half your [caster level](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/magic#TOC-Caster-Level). If it dies, its corpse rapidly putrefies. The next creature to touch the corpse within 1 minute per level of the target’s death causes the corpse to explode in a 10-foot-radius burst, dealing 3d6 points of [acid](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/equipment/goods-and-services/herbs-oils-other-substances#TOC-Acid) damage ([Reflex](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/gamemastering/combat#TOC-Reflex) half).

name: Blood Money
description:
You cast _blood money_ just before casting another spell. As part of this spell’s casting, you must cut one of your hands, releasing a stream of blood that causes you to take 1d6 points of damage. When you cast another spell in that same round, your blood transforms into one material component of your choice required by that second spell. Even valuable [components](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/magic#TOC-Components) worth more than 1 gp can be created, but creating such material [components](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/magic#TOC-Components) requires an additional cost of 1 point of [Strength damage](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/basics-ability-scores/ability-scores#TOC-Ability-Score-Damage), plus a further point of damage for every full 500 gp of the component’s value (so a component worth 500–999 gp costs a total of 2 points, 1,000–1,500 costs 3, etc.). You cannot create magic items with _blood money_.

For example, a [sorcerer](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/classes/core-classes/sorcerer) with the spell [stoneskin](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/magic/all-spells/b/s/stoneskin) prepared could cast _blood money_ to create the 250 gp worth of diamond dust required by that spell, taking 1d6 points of damage and 1 point of [Strength damage](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/basics-ability-scores/ability-scores#TOC-Ability-Score-Damage) in the process.

Material [components](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/magic#TOC-Components) created by _blood money_ transform back into blood at the end of the round if they have not been used as a material component. Spellcasters who do not have blood cannot cast _blood money_, and those who are immune to [Strength damage](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/basics-ability-scores/ability-scores#TOC-Ability-Score-Damage) (such as [undead](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/bestiary/rules-for-monsters/creature-types#TOC-Undead) spellcasters) cannot use _blood money_ to create valuable material [components](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/magic#TOC-Components).

name: Burst of Adrenaline
description: You draw upon your body’s inner reserves of strength, leaving you winded. When you are about to make a d20 roll based on [Strength](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/basics-ability-scores/ability-scores#TOC-Strength-Str-), [Dexterity](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/basics-ability-scores/ability-scores#TOC-Dexterity-Dex-), or [Constitution](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/basics-ability-scores/ability-scores#TOC-Constitution-Con-), you can cast this spell to gain a +8 [enhancement bonus](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/basics-ability-scores/glossary#TOC-Enhancement-Bonus) to [Strength](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/basics-ability-scores/ability-scores#TOC-Strength-Str-), [Dexterity](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/basics-ability-scores/ability-scores#TOC-Dexterity-Dex-), or [Constitution](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/basics-ability-scores/ability-scores#TOC-Constitution-Con-) for that roll, but you are [fatigued](http://www.d20pfsrd.com/gamemastering/conditions#TOC-Fatigued) for 1 round afterward.

name: Clarion Call
description: The subject of this spell gains two benefits. First, the affected creature gains the ability to create a sound like the blast of a mighty horn or trumpet simply by miming the action of sounding one. Second, the subject can speak in a booming voice that carries easily over great distances, lowering the DC of any check to hear what is said by –15. This spell is particularly prized by battlefield commanders and champions who wish to make themselves clearly heard or gain the attention of their allies or foes.
